Package org.waarp.openr66.protocol.monitoring

Classes implementing Monitoring to send to external Monitor for OpenR66 as JSON status from time to time, using either a REST API or Elasticsearch as destination (Elasticsearch from JRE 8 using Waarp-S3 module)

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    ElasticsearchMonitoringExporterClient  
    ElasticsearchMonitoringExporterClientFactory
    ElasticsearchMonitoringExporterClient Factory (only available in JRE 8 and over and if a Factory is set into ElasticsearchMonitoringExporterClientBuilder)
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    ElasticsearchMonitoringExporterClientBuilder
    Builder of ElasticsearchMonitoringExporterClientFactory
    HttpMonitoringExporterClient
    HttpMonitoringExporterClient used by the MonitorExporterTransfers
    HttpMonitoringExporterClientHandler  
    HttpMonitoringExporterClientInitializer  
    MonitorExporterTransfers
    The Monitor exports Transfers into a Json Format to a remote API REST or an Elasticsearch server (if JRE >= 8) in order to allow to monitor multiple Waarp Servers from one central monitoring, such as using Elasticsearch with Kibana/Grafana through RESP API from Logstash engine or equivalent, or your own REST API server or a Elasticsearch server.

Package org.waarp.openr66.protocol.monitoring Description

Classes implementing Monitoring to send to external Monitor for OpenR66 as JSON status from time to time, using either a REST API or Elasticsearch as destination (Elasticsearch from JRE 8 using Waarp-S3 module)
